title: Even universal sums of triangular numbers
abstract:
For an arbitrary integer $x$, an integer of the form
$T(x)\!=\!\frac{x^2+x}{2}$ is called a triangular number. Let
$\alpha_1,\dots,\alpha_k$ be positive integers. A sum
$\Delta_{\alpha_1,\dots,\alpha_k}(x_1,\dots,x_k)=\alpha_1
T(x_1)+\cdots+\alpha_k T(x_k)$ of triangular numbers is said to be even
universal if the Diophantine equation
$\Delta_{\alpha_1,\dots,\alpha_k}(x_1,\dots,x_k)=2n$ has an integer solution
$(x_1,\dots,x_k)\in\mathbb{Z}^k$ for any nonnegative integer $n$. In this
article, we classify all even universal sums of triangular numbers.
Furthermore, we provide an effective criterion on even universality of an
arbitrary sum of triangular numbers, which is a generalization of the
triangular theorem of eight of Bosma and Kane.
